item.title: Diving Into the Enigmatic World of Deep Sea Creatures – A Photo Essay
item.description:
Despite the challenging conditions of the deep sea, life thrives in this surreal world. The pressure can be unfathomable, temperatures can plummet to subzero, and darkness is all-consuming, yet a vast array of life forms, ranging from bioluminescent jellyfish to colossal squids, showcase exquisite diversity and beauty.

The deep sea is an enigmatic and mesmerising environment that never ceases to amaze us with its extraordinary inhabitants. Join us as we embark on an extraordinary expedition to the unfamiliar, as we unravel the wonders of the deep sea and the creatures that inhabit it.

item.title: Exploring the microscopic world: 10 stunning photos
item.description:
1. Sand: Composed of finely divided rock and mineral particles, sand looks surprisingly beautiful under a microscope. This image shows the star-shaped sand in Hatoma Island. Photo: Alain Couette/CC BY-SA 3.0

2. Butterfly wing: Thousands of pigmented scales cover butterfly wings, giving the insect its magnificent colourful appearance. Photo: Zeiss Microscopy/CC BY-NC-ND 2.0

3. Sea water: This image shows a range of marine microplankton found in sea water. Photo: David Liittschwager/CC BY-SA 4.0

item.title: 10 most fascinating scientific discoveries of 2021
item.description:
1. Medicine/ mRNA vaccines: We found a new way to directly talk to our body! 

An illustration of the mechanism of action of a messenger RNA vaccine. Photo: Jmarchn

Vaccines have been around — and have noticeably extended the life expectancy of humans — since a few centuries ago. Research on mRNA technology is also longstanding and has been conducted for decades. What is new, however, is the ability to harness the power of mRNA in developing state-of-the-art vaccines.
